hero.h1: Hack the system & win awesome prizes!
hero.p: A 2-day chance in Amsterdam to network, learn and share knowledge with your peers next 19th and 20th of June 2015.

description.p:
The Backbase Hackathon is hosting developers from all around the world, providing an opportunity to create new application concepts to shake up the banking industry. This is achieved by combining technologies and making small, yet significant dents in some of the most difficult problems, in whatever language, in whatever framework, in whatever development stack, and time is your only enemy. It’s a unique opportunity to delve into open APIs and technologies to create new applications for banking customers (and other businesses).

The game is on! Are you in?

attendance.p: We’re looking for a creative mix of people for the two-day Backbase Hackathon – coders, designers and entrepreneurs! The aim is to compete, so we can innovate together and move digital banking forwards.

prizes.p: At the end of the Hackathon, each team leader will present a 15-minute prototype demo to a jury of Backbase managers, as well as representatives of the Hackathon sponsor company.

apply.h3: Join us on this 2-day hackathon in Amsterdam!
apply.p:
The inaugural Backbase Hackathon invites you to apply today. Don’t waste time! Get this form filled in as soon as possible!

The aim is to compete, so we can innovate together and move digital banking forwards. Here are some simple rules to abide by:

  1. Play nice - The Backbase motto in 2015 is ‘Make it really nice’, and we’d like to keep things really nice when we’re working in our teams. That means no belittling, bullying or stealing someone else’s shoes, and so on. Please respect your teammates and your competitors.
  2. Work from a Backbase location – You can join the Hackathon remotely from any Backbase location, which includes Amsterdam, New York, Atlanta, or London. Please bring your own laptop.
  3. Sign up as a team– A team can consist of 2-5 members, and can comprise a mix of talents. For instance, a team could include a coder, a user experience expert, or an entrepreneur – any flavor will do.
